bibl.title: An Afterthought on the Names Flavius and Aurelius.
bibl.note: A gathering of nine references shows how deeply ingrained the Flavius-Aurelius pattern was in Byzantine Egyptian notarial and bureaucratic practice. It was possible to conjecture a man's status, Fl. or Aur., from his position in the community, or from his function, and to draft one's documents accordingly.
bibl.seg: Keenan James G., An Afterthought on the Names Flavius and Aurelius.

A gathering of nine references shows how deeply ingrained the Flavius-Aurelius pattern was in Byzantine Egyptian notarial and bureaucratic practice. It was possible to conjecture a man's status, Fl. or Aur., from his position in the community, or from his function, and to draft one's documents accordingly.
